H0.text: It will destroy the fish habitat, which is how excess soil that travels downstream reduces biodiversity, as the scientist observed that loss of plants near a stream increased soil erosion downstream.

H1.text: It will provide nutrients to algae when excess soil is washed downstream, reducing biodiversity.

H2.text: It will change the water temperature, thereby reducing biodiversity in the stream ecosystem.

H3.text: It will introduce an invasive species that reduces biodiversity when excess soil is washed downstream after plants near a stream are lost.

A4.text: Movement of sediment is important in providing habitat for fish and other organisms in rivers.

A5.text: empirical data show that fish effectively avoid the impacted area.

A6.text: The sediment accumulation on the bottom may bury organisms to the point that they starve or even die.
